intro: Cryptantha subamplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant is characterized by its basal leaves that wrap around the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and it typically blooms in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
